bug.short_desc: fail2ban is missing /var/run/fail2ban after installation and refuses to start
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: This issue seems identical to #1422500 (for EL7). After installation of fail2ban on Fedora 25 the service won't start because /var/run/fail2ban/ does not exists. After reboot the service started without a problem. Would it be possible to port the fix for EL7 back to Fedora 25?
fail2ban-client[14486]: ERROR There is no directory /var/run/fail2ban to contain the socket file /var/run/fail2ban/fail2ban.sock.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): fail2ban-0.9.6-2.fc25.noarch
How reproducible: After installation.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. dns install fail2ban 2. systemctl start fail2ban
Actual results: fail2ban-client[14486]: ERROR There is no directory /var/run/fail2ban to contain the socket file /var/run/fail2ban/fail2ban.sock.
